t: 1 Chronicles 7
The Family of Issachar
The*p sons of Issachar were*i Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron—four in*i all.*i

The sons of Tola were*i Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father’s house. The*i sons*i of Tola were*i mighty men of valor in their generations; their number in the days of David was*i twenty-two thousand six hundred.
The son of Uzzi was*i Izrahiah, and the sons of Izrahiah were*i Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Ishiah. All five of them were*i chief men.
And with them, by their generations, according to their fathers’ houses, were*i thirty-six thousand troops ready for war; for they had many wives and sons.
Now*p their brethren among all the families of Issachar were*i mighty men of valor, listed by their genealogies, eighty-seven thousand in all.
The Family of Benjamin
The*ip sons*i of Benjamin were*i Bela, Becher, and Jediael—three in*i all.*i

The sons of Bela were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri—five in*i all.*i They were*i heads of their*i fathers’ houses, and they were listed by their genealogies, twenty-two thousand and thirty-four mighty men of valor.
The*p sons of Becher were*i Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jerimoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these are*i the sons of Becher.
And they were recorded by genealogy according to their generations, heads of their fathers’ houses, twenty thousand two hundred mighty men of valor.
The son of Jediael was*i Bilhan, and the sons of Bilhan were*i Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tharshish, and Ahishahar.
All*p these sons of Jediael were*i heads of their fathers’ houses; there*i were*i seventeen thousand two hundred mighty men of valor fit to go out for war and*i battle.
Shuppim and Huppim were*i the sons of Ir, and*i Hushim was*i the son of Aher.
The Family of Naphtali
The*p sons of Naphtali were*i Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.
The Family of Manasseh (West)
The*p descendants of Manasseh: his Syrian concubine bore him Machir the father of Gilead, the father of Asriel.
Machir took as his wife the*i sister*i of Huppim and Shuppim, whose name was*i Maachah. The name of Gilead’s*i grandson was*i Zelophehad, but Zelophehad begot only daughters.
(Maachah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she called his name Peresh. The name of his brother was*i Sheresh, and his sons were*i Ulam and Rakem.
The son of Ulam was*i Bedan.) These were*i the descendants of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
His*p sister Hammoleketh bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
And*p the sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
The Family of Ephraim
The*p sons of Ephraim were*i Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eladah his son, Tahath his son,
Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead. The men of Gath who were born in that*i land killed them*i because they came down to take away their cattle.
Then Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brethren came to comfort him.
And*p when he went in to his wife, she conceived and bore a son; and he called his name Beriah, because tragedy had come upon his house.
Now his daughter was*i Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth Horon and Uzzen Sheerah;
and Rephah was*i his son, as*i well*i as Resheph, and Telah his son, Tahan his son,
Laadan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
Nun his son, and Joshua his son.
Now*p their possessions and dwelling places were*i Bethel and its towns: to the east Naaran, to the west Gezer and its towns, and Shechem and its towns, as far as Ayyah and its towns;

and by the borders of the children of Manasseh were*i Beth Shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, Dor and its towns. In these dwelt the children of Joseph, the son of Israel.
The Family of Asher
The*p sons of Asher were*i Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.
The sons of Beriah were*i Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
And Heber begot Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.
The sons of Japhlet were*i Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were*i the children of Japhlet.
The sons of Shemer were*i Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.
And the sons of his brother Helem were*i Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
The sons of Zophah were*i Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Jithran, and Beera.
The sons of Jether were*i Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.
The sons of Ulla were*i Arah, Haniel, and Rizia.

All*p these were*i the children of Asher, heads of their*i fathers’ houses, choice men, mighty men of valor, chief leaders. And they were recorded by genealogies among the army fit for battle; their number was*i twenty-six thousand.
